steps.title: Follow the beat of the music.
steps.content: Follow the beat of the music. Most moves take up one beat in the song. Count out the beat and move your body step by step as the song plays. [1] X Research source As you learn the dance, start without music and go at your own pace. Once you get more familiar with the moves, try matching the beat of the song.

steps.title: Bring your arms out in front of you one at a time.
steps.content: Bring your arms out in front of you one at a time. When introduction ends, lift your right arm straight out in front of you, then your left arm. Make sure your arms are parallel with the floor with your palms facing down. [2] X Research source In the most popular version of the song, the introduction lasts 16 counts. Listen for an “Ay!” Then, start moving your arms. Hold your arms in line with your shoulders.

steps.title: Turn your palms upward one at a time.
steps.content: Turn your palms upward one at a time. Turn your right palm up first, then turn your left palm up. Rotate your forearms outward to turn your palms up. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place your right hand on your left shoulder.
steps.content: Place your right hand on your left shoulder. Keep your elbow in place as you cross your forearm over your chest. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place your left hand on your right shoulder.
steps.content: Place your left hand on your right shoulder. Cross your left arm over your right arm to create an “X” shape over your chest. Now, both palms are on your shoulders. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Put your hands on the back of your head one at a time.
steps.content: Put your hands on the back of your head one at a time. Bring one hand up and around to the back of your head. Then, put your other hand on the back of your head. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Bring your hands down to the opposite hip one at a time.
steps.content: Bring your hands down to the opposite hip one at a time. First bring your right hand down to your left hip. Then bring your left hand down to your right hip. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Switch your hands to the other hip one at a time.
steps.content: Switch your hands to the other hip one at a time. Move your right hand (currently on your left hip) over to your right hip. Then move your left hand (currently on your right hip) over to your left hip. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Shake your hips.
steps.content: Shake your hips. As the song says, "Hey Macarena," keep your hands on your hips as you rotate them. Your feet should stay planted on the ground. [9] X Research source Unlike other moves in this dance, this move takes up 4 beats rather than one. Keep performing this step as the singers hold out, “Hey Macarena.” If you have trouble moving your hips, nod your head to the beat of the music instead.

steps.title: Jump and turn your body 90 degrees to the left.
steps.content: Jump and turn your body 90 degrees to the left. When you land, face the new direction. Each time you finish the basic dance sequence, jump and turn 90 degrees to the left. [10] X Research source If you’re doing the dance in a chair, clap your hands once at this point in the sequence. [11] X Research source Another quirky move you can try is the “scuba dive.” While pinching your nose with one hand, raise the opposite arm and bring it down, wiggling it like a snake.

steps.title: Clap your hands and repeat the sequence.
steps.content: Clap your hands and repeat the sequence. Run through the same steps, this time facing in a different direction. When you finish the step sequence again, jump and turn 90 degrees to the left. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Play the song “Macarena.”
steps.content: Play the song “Macarena.” The Macarena is always danced to “Macarena.” The original song is by Los Del Rio, but you can dance to any version!

steps.title: Move your hips from side to side.
steps.content: Move your hips from side to side. Let your shoulders move up and down as you do it. The goal is to loosen up your body. This isn’t a part of the actual dance, but it will keep you from looking stiff and let you get used to the rhythm. [13] X Research source There’s a brief intro to the song before the lyrics start. Use this time to start loosening up your body for the dance.

steps.title: Start dancing when the introduction ends.
steps.content: Start dancing when the introduction ends. Remember, you start by putting out your right arm, then left arm, with your palms facing down. Each step lasts 1 count, or about 1 second. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Remember to turn 90 degrees after each step sequence.
steps.content: Remember to turn 90 degrees after each step sequence. Be sure to turn on the jump after you rotate your hips. After you turn, clap your hands and repeat the step sequence. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Keep dancing until the song is over.
steps.content: Keep dancing until the song is over. Run through the step sequence, jump and turn, and repeat! If you get tired of dancing before the songs over, just stop and exit the dance floor.
